translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The thirteenth section🔽The discussion on the covered
“Is one who is covered getting rid of the hindrances?”
“Yes.”

original: Ratto rāgaṁ jahati, duṭṭho dosaṁ jahati, mūḷho mohaṁ jahati, kiliṭṭho kilese jahatīti?
analyzed: rattaḥ rāgam jahati duṭṭhaḥ dosam jahati mūḷhaḥ moham jahati kiliṭṭhaḥ kilese jahati iti
translated: “Is one who is greedy getting rid of greed, one who is hating getting rid of hate, one who is deluded getting rid of delusion, one who is soiled getting rid of defilements?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: rāgena rāgaṁ jahati, dosena dosaṁ jahati, mohena mohaṁ jahati, kilesehi kilese jahatīti?
analyzed: rāgena rāgam jahati dosena dosam jahati mohena moham jahati kilesehi kilese jahati iti
translated: “Does one get rid of greed with greed, of hate with hate, of delusion with delusion, of defilements with defilements?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: rāgaḥ citta sampayuttaḥ maggo citta sampayutto ti
translated: “Is greed associated with consciousness, is the path associated with consciousness?”
“Yes.”
“Is there a meeting together, a coming together, of two kinds of contact, of two kinds of consciousness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is greed unprofitable, is the path profitable?”
“Yes.”

original: Kusalākusalā sāvajjānavajjā hīnapaṇītā kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgā dhammā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: kusala akusalā sāvajja anavajjāḥ hīna paṇītā kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgāḥ dhammā sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Do profitable and unprofitable, blameless and blamable, inferior and superior ideas come face to face?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Kusalākusalā sāvajjānavajjā hīnapaṇītā kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgā dhammā sammukhībhāvaṁ āgacchantīti?
analyzed: kusala akusalā sāvajja anavajjāḥ hīna paṇītā kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgāḥ dhammā sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: Do wholesome and unwholesome, blameable and blameless, inferior and refined, dark and bright states with their counterparts come into focus?
“Yes.”
“But has it not been said by the Blessed One:

analyzed: cattāri imāni bhikkhave su vidūra vidūrāni
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, these four are very far apart.
What four?
The sky and the earth, bhikkhus, are very far apart.🔽This is the first thing that is very far apart. …

original: idaṁ paṭhamaṁ suvidūravidūraṁ …pe… tasmā sataṁ dhammo asabbhi ārakā”ti.
analyzed: idam paṭhamam su vidūra vidūram tasmai satam dhammaḥ
translated: The Dhamma of the good person is far from that of the bad person.’
“Is there such a discourse?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: tena hi na vattabba  kusala akusalā pe  sammukhībhāvam āgacchanti iti
translated: “Well then, you should not say so.
Do wholesome and unwholesome, blameable and blameless, inferior and refined, dark and bright states with their counterparts come into focus?
“Yes.”
“But has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: “so evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmetī”ti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti iti
translated: ‘When his concentrated mind is thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’
“Is there such a discourse?”
“Yes.”
“Well then, you should not say so.
Do those in jhana abandon the hindrances?”
“Is it not to be said that
one who is secluded abandons the hindrances?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati …pe…
analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā  tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccati pe
translated: “But has it not been said by the Blessed One:🔽‘When one knows and sees thus, bhikkhus, the mind is liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance’?

analyzed: avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccati iti
translated: “Yes.”
“Then the suttas are contradicted.”
“Yes.”

analyzed: tena hi nivutaḥ nīvaraṇam jahati iti
translated: “Then it is not true that one who is secluded abandons the taint of sensual desire, the taint of being, and the taint of ignorance.”
The Discussion of One Who is Secluded is finished.
